title.narrative: PAN-LASE: Building human capacity in research animal sciences and ethics to prevent disease and promote the health and wellbeing of humans and animals

description.narrative: Our aim is to develop and grow the Pan African Network of Laboratory Animal Sciences and Ethics (PAN-LASE) initiative. We will establish a sustainable programme of education, training and continuing professional development activities in research animal sciences and ethics in six African Countries (Botswana, Kenya, Nigeria, South Africa, Tunisia, Uganda), institutional animal research ethics committees where these do not currently exist, and facilitate the establishment of a research animal sciences association in a seventh (Ethiopia). In so doing, we will enable African colleagues to undertake worldleading research to address the continents specific health, economic and social challenges. To achieve this, we will: 1. Co-create and co-deliver, with partners in each country, “Train the Educator/Trainer” courses for researchers, vets, animal care staff, animal research ethics committee members and administrators, and educators/trainers in the host country; 2. Share global good practice in research animal sciences, animal welfare and ethics; 3. Provide training in, and hands-on experience of, active learning educational approaches; 4. Create a sustainable network of educators and trainers in each country by providing course participants with the training, tools and free, creative commons licenced, open educational resources to subsequently deliver this education/training in their own Institutions and networks; 5. Contribute to addressing the gender inequality balance in STEM research; 6. Provide mentoring and support for educators and trainers in their subsequent delivery of courses; 7. Consult on the development of a Pan-African online platform for providing introductory education and training in research animal sciences; 8. Facilitate the dissemination and promotion of national/Pan-African animal ethics guidelines, and the development and establishment of Institutional animal ethics committees, providing mentoring and support as required; 9. Provide mentoring and support for colleagues in establishing national laboratory/research animal sciences associations where these do not currently exist.
